Class ObjectDetector

java.lang.Object
  ObjectDetector

public class ObjectDetector
extends java.lang.Object

Takes care of recognizing what the object in range is using a color sensor and sets a signal for search to respond in consequence. The signals are WALL, WOOD_BLOCK, and FLAG and are retrieved by getObject().

                      TwoWheeledRobot robot,

Constructor for ObjectDector

Parameters:
colorSensor - the color sensor used to recognize the objects
robot - the TwoWheeledRobot robot
usPoller - the ultrasonic poller
Method Detail

doObjectDetection

public int doObjectDetection()
When the ultrasonic poller reports a distance under 15 cm, doObjectDetection determines if it is the flag or an obstacle. It returns an int corresponding to the object it is.

avoid

public void avoid()
Sets a signal for the navigation that it needs to avoid an obstacle.

capture

public void capture()
Sets a signal for the search that it needs to capture the flag.

rotateAndPoll

public void rotateAndPoll(int flagColor)
Once we are on one side of the opponent's zone we rotate to scan all the blocks on that side and if it sees the flag it calls avoid() otherwise the robot travels to the other side and rotate and polls again. Takes an int representing the color of the flag as input.

getObject

public ObjectDetector.ObjectType getObject()
It returns what the object is.

Returns:
the case either WALL, WOOD_BLOCK or FLAG.
